meanings.definition: Excessive or exaggerated action or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her overaction to the small problem made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: His overaction to the surprise gift was heartwarming.
meanings.sent3: The play's overaction of the characters added a comedic touch.
meanings.sent4: The overaction of the villain made him seem larger than life.
meanings.sent5: The overaction of the clown made the children giggle uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: The act of overreacting or showing excessive emotion.
meanings.sent1: His overaction to the sad movie brought tears to his eyes.
meanings.sent2: The overaction of the actress in the play moved the audience.
meanings.sent3: Her overaction to the spilled milk was met with surprise by her friends.
meanings.sent4: The overaction of the crowd at the concert was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The overaction of the puppy when its owner returned was pure joy.

meanings.definition: To perform with excessive or exaggerated movements or expressions.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overaction when telling stories, making them more entertaining.
meanings.sent2: The actor's overaction in the scene added a dramatic flair.
meanings.sent3: The children overactioned their excitement for the upcoming field trip.
meanings.sent4: He overactioned his surprise at the birthday party, pretending not to know.
meanings.sent5: The comedian overactioned his punchline, making the audience burst into laughter.
